v.v: The prayer of Habakkuk the prophet:
Yahweh, I have heard your report, and I am afraid.
God came from Teman, and the Holy One from Mount Paran.
With brightness like the light, two-pronged rays flash from his hand;
He stood and measured the earth; he looked and shook the nations.
I saw the tents of Cushan in affliction, and the fabric of the tents in the land of Midian trembling.
Was Yahweh angry at the rivers? Was your wrath against the rivers,
You have brought out your bow without a cover; you put arrows to your bow!
The mountains saw you and twisted in pain.
The sun and moon stood still in their high places
You have marched over the earth with indignation. In wrath you have threshed the nations.
You went out for the salvation of your people, for the salvation of your anointed one.
You have pierced the head of his warriors with his own arrows since they came like a storm to scatter us,
You have traveled over the sea with your horses, and heaped up the great waters.
I heard, and my inner parts trembled! My lips quivered at the sound.
Though the fig tree does not bud
Still, I will rejoice in Yahweh.
The Lord Yahweh is my strength

v: Yahweh, revive your work in the midst of these times; in the midst of these times make it known;
remember to have compassion in your wrath.
His glory covered the heavens, and the earth was full of his praise.
and there he hid his power.
and the plague followed him.
Even the eternal mountains were shattered, and the everlasting hills bowed down.
His path is everlasting.
or your fury against the sea,
when you rode upon your horses and your victorious chariots?
You divided the earth with rivers.
Downpours of water passed over them; the deep sea raised a shout.
It lifted up its waves.
at the flash of your arrows as they fly,
at the lightning of your flashing spear.
You shatter the head of the house of the wicked to lay bare from the base up to the neck.
their gloating was like one who devours the poor in a hiding place.
Decay comes into my bones, and under myself I tremble
as I wait quietly for the day of distress to come upon the people who invade us.
and there is no produce from the vines;
and though the produce of the olive tree disappoints
and the fields yield no food;
and though the flock is cut off from the fold
and there are no cattle in the stalls, this is what I will do.
I will be joyful because of the God of my salvation.
and he makes my feet like the deer’s.
He makes me go forward on my high places.
—To the music director, on my stringed instruments.
